definitions.definition: A flag normally used by naval vessels to represent a special condition.

subdefinitions.definition: The broad pennant flown by commodores .
The church pennant indicating religious services are taking place aboard ship.
The commissioning pennant flown on ceremonial occasions.

definitions.definition: A small flag with pointed end, formerly carried by cavalry or other mounted troops to serve as a rallying point or ceremonial unit identification.
The winning of a competition, represented by a flag.
examples: The New York Yankees have won the American League pennant far more often than any other team.

definitions.definition: A commemorative flag , traditionally triangular and made of felt , typically used to show support for a particular athletic team .
A rope or strap to which a purchase is hooked.
A sandstone between coal measures in parts of South Wales
Either of two species of libellulid dragonfly of the genus Macrodiplax , of the tropics and subtropics.

main_definition: A flag normally used by naval vessels to represent a special condition.

A rope or strap to which a purchase is hooked.
A sandstone between coal measures in parts of South Wales
Either of two species of libellulid dragonfly of the genus Macrodiplax , of the tropics and subtropics.
